enb_long_title: Year-End Update on the Framework Convention on Climate Change 1995
sentences: Espen Rønneberg stated that the findings of the IPCC, which testify to the reality of climate change, are indeed being confirmed by the increasing frequency and severity of storms.
These storms are ever more damaging to the economies of the affected countries, particularly the most vulnerable small island States.
It is imperative that the actions mandated in the Convention be undertaken immediately to avert climatic disaster on a global scale.
Support and funding for adaptation measures should be a priority, as should work on mitigation efforts.
Urgent attention should also be focused on the completion of the work of the Berlin Mandate.
Efforts to improve the prospects for future global climatic stability must not be sacrificed for short-term economic interests.
